projects.name: Story game - The Survivors
projects.description: This story like game lets the user interact and move back and forth between different phases/locations of the game. The project was created to learn how to use Zustand and POST the reply of the user to the API. The data is stored and global, based on the users name input.

projects.name: Movie site
projects.description: A movie site that displays the movie titles from the API at themoviedb.org. The project's aim was to learn React Router dom to navigate between different categories. I decided to also create a carousel since it felt suiting for the theme of a movie site, this was an interesting new experience.

projects.name: Todo list
projects.description: This Todo list was created as a opportunity to learn how to use Context to pass global states, and come up with an intuitive UI displaying what to do and what's completed, and be able to toggle the status. We used Moment.js for the time and added sounds with useSound. As a final touch I added a API call for daily quotes.

projects.name: Music Releases
projects.description: A music release site fetching and displaying newly released albums from Spotify API. Today it works as a template for adding and liking albums, with a hover button that leads to the albums spotify page rather than playing live. The project focused on adding and working with displaying API results.

projects.name: Weather App
projects.description: This weather app lets you search for the weather, sunrise and sunset and temperature in any city of your preference. The theme and colors react to the current weather. The focus of the project was to Learn how to fetch API and change the DOM with conditional statements

projects.name: Survey
projects.description: A survey about pizza, that was made as a team project to learn how to work with useState and components in React. The result is individualized and based on your replies, where you get a pizza date with chosen celebrity

projects.name: Happy Thoughts Tweet
projects.description: This tweet site is connected to a Live Happy Thoughts API, which lets you add your current thougts to the open tweet while reading and liking the thoughts of others. The feed is constantly updated and lets you interact with others.

projects.name: Library
projects.description: A library project to learn how to use Objects and Arrays, DOM manipulation and conditionals, where we got to choose a theme on stored information that we wanted to display. This library contains destinations, that you can sort, order and randomize and search for wished specification.

projects.name: Chatbot
projects.description: The chatbot was the first proper Javascript app that I created in the Technigo Bootcamp, to learn how to use basic Javascipt. My team chose to create an ordering chat for a cafe, where you get to make basic choices and the bot will respond to what you choose.

projects.name: First HTML website
projects.description: This pure HTML + CSS-project was my first website as part of the preparation course of Technigo Bootcamp, to learn all the HTML/CSS basics before going forward with Javascript. This website is a news site on bonsai trees, with different sections for different format news.
